meanings.definition: A network of fine lines or wires in the focus of the eyepiece of an optical instrument.
meanings.sent1: The scientist adjusted the graticules in the microscope to focus on the tiny cells.
meanings.sent2: The graticules in the telescope helped the astronomer pinpoint the location of the distant star.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student pretended the graticules in the microscope were a tiny city for bacteria.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt like a jumble of graticules, each line representing a different thought.
meanings.sent5: The intricate graticules in the camera lens created a mesmerizing pattern of light and shadow.

meanings.definition: A network of lines representing meridians and parallels, on which a map or plan can be represented.
meanings.sent1: The cartographer carefully drew the graticules on the map to show the coordinates of each location.
meanings.sent2: The graticules on the globe helped students understand how latitude and longitude work.
meanings.sent3: The treasure map had graticules that led to a hidden surprise in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: In her mind, the graticules of life's journey intersected at unexpected moments.
meanings.sent5: The graticules on the blueprint guided the construction workers in building the new house.
